leads.lead_text: Phyllodes more-or-less isodiametric, rhombic to circular in cross-section, 1–1.5 mm diameter; mature pods glabrous or sparsely covered with short appressed hairs
Phyllodes not isodiametric, distinctly flattened, dorsiventrally >1.5 mm, mature pods with sparse to moderate covering of appressed hairs. Grampians, Otways and Wilsons Promontory
Phyllodes mostly 25–70(–90) mm long, >20 times longer than wide. Gippsland, mostly east of Orbost
Phyllodes 14–26 mm (rarely to 40 mm) long, <20 times longer than wide. Widespread through central Victoria, Grampians, outer Melbourne area
